website_summaries.verdict: We love how this sander powers through multiple layers of paint and varnish without a problem, and its variable speed helps with control. Dust collection is an issue, however.
pros: Sander is “aggressive” - better for removing blemishes than finishing wood pieces
Front handle’s option to switch to left or right side gives users greater control
cons: Can’t be attached to a Shop-Vac hose to control dust, though a few users rigged up a system
Vibration is a problem for some
Variable speed switch is placed awkwardly
Velcro attachment tends to weaken after a few dozen disc changes

customer_reviews.title: Starting to throw discs
customer_reviews.text: Up until the last few times using this sander, I've been very happy with its performance. Lately, as a few other buyers have mentioned, the sander has started throwing discs. I've owned the sander a little better than a year, but I bet I haven't had more than 30 discs changed. Seems like the velcro grippers shouldn't be shot this soon.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Good sander;  5-hole PC sander pad is adaptable to this Makita
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing a 30 year old Porter Cable Quicksand. I have a whole pile of 5-hole velcro sanding discs and a couple of new extra 5-hole sanding pads. I found I can swap sanding pads. They both have the same 3-hole mounting screws. You need to cut a 29mm hole saw groove through the plastic face and a 1/2" center hole, both only 1/16'" or so deep. I will use up my supply and then go to the 8-hole system. The sander works just as fast as my PC, but is quieter and smoother. Overall I am pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: John D. McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Makita BO5041K 5-Inch Random Orbit Sander Kit
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of sanding. Some mentioned not being able to connect it to their shop vacuum. I went to a farm/home dealer and found a rubber tube that I reamed out slightly and it fit perfectly over the outlet on the sander and the small hose on my shop vacuum and keeps sanding dust down substantially. Easy to handle and variable speed gives great finish.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ergonomics but defective pad makes it unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Good -Great ergonomics, nice design. pleasant to use. Bad - sanding disks do not adhere to pad. Same disks work fine on my other 5" sander. First disk applied and used worked well but was difficult to remove. Every disk tried after that would not adhere and those same disks worked fine with my older DeWalt 5" sander. Note that others have reported the same problem with this unit .
customer_reviews.author: JLouisIII

customer_reviews.title: Dust Cap is Hard to Position
customer_reviews.text: I would give 5 stars, however I do not like the dust catcher. It sits too low and scrapes across the material. Also, its hard to get it to stop from coming apart especially after emptying. Not good when I'm collecting lead paint dust. Called Makita and they suggested I not take the plastic cap off the dust catcher and just empty it with the cap in place. Really? Very awkward. The sander is great as far as power goes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Pleasure to Use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Makita Palm Sander for everything for years and I love it. However, sometimes you just need an orbital sander to take off a bit more material. I use this sander almost daily in my woodshop (garage). I bought a box of various grits of sandpaper disks and am sanding the daylighjts out of everything. I am using the 80 grit to smooth out pallet wood and the finer grits to smooth out shelving and pine. A real pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: dyle51Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Backing pad wore out after less than 20 disks.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Makita guy and have had good luck with them. Unfortunately the black backing pad on this wore out extremely quickly, less than 20 sanding disk changes. The disks are barely holding on and are flying off. I had to order a replacement pad which according to the reviews is also suffering from the same issue. Otherwise the tool is good. Lots of power and doesn't bog down. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Bolt of Rust

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet little sander and an excellent value. We purchased it to prep the wood siding and soffits for a major repainting of our 130-year-old house. With the right grit of paper, the sander had no problem getting through multiple layers of ancient paint where we tore off a porch that didn't belong. The dust collection system works better than any sander I have used; that's especially important to us with a house this old. It's also super easy to change the sanding discs and the pad really grips, unlike some sanders where the sandpaper starts to migrate off the pad a few minutes after you change it.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: The "KIT" is just the Tool + $30 plastic case w/ no storage room. #120 abrasive Disc was missing
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed to discover the "KIT" was just the tool plus a very basic plastic carrying case. The plastic carrying case has no slots or room to store any sanding discs. It is not worth the extra $30. It's a tight fit as is, and you have to make sure the cord is wrapped just right to get it to close. Also, the description said it came with a #120 abrasive disc. Mine did not. Luckily I had ordered some and they arrived the same day the tool "KIT" did, which enabled me to test it out. It seemed to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Zephyr

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it until the pad started throwing discs. This of course happened after the 30 warranty. Makita will not stand by their product. Avoid this! Replacement pads do the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: jason k

customer_reviews.title: The speed lever sticks at high speed.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the drill. Liked the variable speed. It wasn't exceptionally noisy. Liked the ease of handling. It worked very well until the speed lever started sticking at high speed after about 20 hours of use. I'd have to use two hands hold it and push against the side of the lever to unlock it. It does that most of the time now, rendering it annoying and possibly dangerous. We sent in the warranty card as soon as we opened the box. We'll see how well they stand behind their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Makita 5 " ROS
customer_reviews.text: Have had Dewalt sanders... the switches go bad, I take them apart and clean them .... then they go bad again. I use them until I can't handle holding the button down, which is uncomfortable on Dewalt's as it is on top & in front. So far after using this once, so good. I expect it to last a few years ... if it doesn't I'll go back to Dewalt because despite the switch issue they do last. I base my buying on longevity, am not sure how people can be expected to give an accurate review until some time has lapsed. So this is just to fulfill duties as prompted in this moment!
customer_reviews.author: Na

customer_reviews.title: Great sander.
customer_reviews.text: While waiting for this to come from Amazon, I got impatient and grabbed a similar spec Dewalt locally to use in the interim. After finally using the Makita, I will not bother with the Dewalt again. More power, better control, great build and simply more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Winslow Throckmorton III

customer_reviews.title: the switches seem to go bad. This one is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of sanding as I rehab furniture. This is my first Makita orbital sander. In the past I have purchased the Bosch and find they do not last that long, the switches seem to go bad. This one is easy to use, except I don't like the "trigger" on switch. It is located in the handle and you have to keep a tight grip to keep the sander running. For a female hand, this gets hard to do over a certain time period. Other than that, the variable speed setting works well, and it sands just great. Hope that I get many years of use out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Two problems: 1) sandpaper slips on pad as soon as you touch the wood, just enough that the rubber of the pad catches on the wood and bounces around. Note the bottom left of the pad on the photo (7 o’clock position). It was completely on the pad before I touched the wood. I’ve tried several different brands of sandpaper:Gorilla, Kingsport, and even Mikata with the same results. 2) I emailed the company twice. The first time the guy treated me like I didn’t know to use the right kind of sanding disks, very condescending. It’s been a week since the last email and I’ve yet heard back from them. It’ll be my last Mikita.
customer_reviews.author: David Steele

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, efficient, well made
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several ro sanders; this is the best. The wide range of speeds makes it more flexible than competitors. The dust collecting system is a surprise; it is by far the best I have used. The bag is very easy to remove and dump out, and it filters out even fine dust. Makita tools are often very smooth and quiet. This sander is no exception. The handles, padding, and low vibration make long hours of sanding bearable. Nice case with this model. What is not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have had it for about 5 months now and I love it. The dust collection on it is great
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a older DeWalt model that did not have speed control. After doing some research I finally settled on this Makita. I have had it for about 5 months now and I love it. The dust collection on it is great. The speed control has been a game changer. It is very comfortable to use because it is not too heavy and the extra handle is great for keeping the sander level across your project. All round a very good sander.
customer_reviews.author: mike marsden

customer_reviews.title: Great sander
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this for refinishing some dressers but eneded up using it for 7 ft x 4ft x 3ft workbench and 4ft tall shelving unit. It did amazing job and save me lots of time. It's very easy to use, I love how easy is to change pads. Bag that comes with it served me well and collected most of the dust. What I dislike is a difference between version that's sold in EU and one in US. The one in EU has aluminum ring where pad goes instead of plastic one which I think gives more on durability of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Slronhill

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement over my older sander.
customer_reviews.text: The Makita BO5041 replaced my 20+ year old Porter-Cable 333. The Makita is very sweet. I like the ability to hold the sander with the handle(s) or like a palm sander. It is much easier to control than the old PC, and has significantly less vibration. My hands don't feel numb after using it anymore. Also, it sands as well or better than the PC. It'll take a little getting used to a trigger switch rather than the simple on/off, but that's not a big deal. It's hard to judge dust collection, but it may be al little better as well. I really like this new sander.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Makita 5" Random Orbit Sander Kit
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome sander. This is the first Makita sander I've owned and I can honestly say this baby is great! I used a couple of times and it does an excellent job. I think most people are familiar with Makita products they are well made and extremely durable. I highly recommend this model to anyone looking for a great quality tool easy to use and very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Billy  Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Handling is easy. Vibration is bearable. I make custom designed furniture. Dust collection is much more bearable with this unit. As stated, it collects about 80% of the particulates. I just use the collection bag, and it works fine. Variable speed is a must. I have about 100 hours use on this as of writing, and the pad is as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Price

customer_reviews.title: A great little machine (that can do big jobs)
customer_reviews.text: I have had essentially the same model sander for the past 20 years. It still works but the speed control has recently developed a problem. For that reason I ordered a new one while I debate having the older one repaired. These are just fantastic sanders and the new model has even been improved. You cannot go wrong with Makita.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Mikita quality - comes with 2 handles
customer_reviews.text: Smooth operation. The low vibration is incredible. The 2 opposing handles (compared to the typical palm orientation) are hard to come by in this price point (under $100). The orbital sanders with palm operation are no fun; the tingling vibrations last for hours. This unit fits in your hand (or both hands) like butter. This unit comes in 2 configurations; with and without a hard case. Opted for the case, which adds about $15. My tools have to be put away for out-of-the-way storage so the case makes that easy. Can’t say enough good things about this sander.
customer_reviews.author: TheyCallMeMacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Control
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a compact but powerful random orbital sander to tackle the most demanding jobs you should really consider getting this Makita. The excellent quality hard plastic body is housing a 3 Amp motor that has enough power that even with some added pressure will not bog down nor get hot. It will not slow down and that’s a key factor for an evenly sanded surface.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months. It works great for finish sanding. I used it so far to sand some new doors before I stained them. Love the extra handle and the variable speed. On low to medium it is quiet. On high it is loud, but effective. I mostly used a medium setting. Appears to be quality made. I recommend and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: ziff

customer_reviews.title: Quality sander...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a DeWalt D26453K variable speed random orbital sander for 10+ yrs. It still works, i lost a screw from pad, and can not find a replacement (which says something about their custom service). This sander weighs about the same, height is comparable, but seems to have smoother operation, i.e less vibration on hand. Only two minor complaints...the lock on button releases with very little pressure, if hit accidentally. second, the dust bag, held in place by friction, fell off a handful of times during a days use. Nothing i cant adjust to. Overall happy with the purchase, my second makita tool.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent orbital sander
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent orbital sander. Comfortable to use, the power on lock is great for when the sander needs to run a considerable time when achieving a finish ready smoothness to panel wood. The dust collection bag works well to keep dust from drifting in the work shop or into your face. However, the dust bag is not easy to empty as the only outlet is back through the opening for the dust port, the bag would benefit from a zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great and Durable but . . .
customer_reviews.text: This is as good a sander as I've ever owned and I've owned quite a few. All the Makita tools I own are good quality. Unfortunately, there is one thing I really dislike. It has a trigger type on/off switch that locks in the on position when you push in a button. The trigger is located on the handle and when you use the sander it's almost impossible to keep you hand away from it and every time you touch it the sander stops. This is a time waster and a substantial inconvenience. Always keeping you finger wrapped around the switch for extended periods of time is also quite inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: MB or RB

customer_reviews.title: One of the top sanders
customer_reviews.text: Virtually vibration free, very high quality, light enough to use all day without fatigue, removable handle is nice touch. Carrying case has enough extra room for a supply of sanding disks. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Pezgallo

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I love nearly everything about this sander. It's quiet and the vibration is low. The adjustable handle is very nice for getting into tight corners. I didn't think I would use the variable speeds, but I found this to be a very useful feature. The only complaint I have is that the trigger comes un-locked sometimes when I grip the handle because of the position of the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: KKapp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sander. Moves plenty of wood even with fine ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sander. Moves plenty of wood even with fine grit. THe round suction vents actually work. This unit will fill the bag with dust after an hour or so (which means its working well). Feels solid, good cable length, not dangerous to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: Glp

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritic handed handymen.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad who loves sanding his woodworking projects and decks and anything else with sharp edges and rough surfaces. He's had really bad arthritis and the old barrel grip sanders just weren't working for his hands anymore. I saw this and a cheaper model by a cheaper company. I'm glad I went with the Makita because he's really putting it through the paces. The two hand grip really reinvigorated his love of hobby woodworking because he can get the same smooth results he used to get before his hands gave out. It was the perfect gift. Now he's refinishing his kitchen chairs and he can't be stopped.
customer_reviews.author: David Cox

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great orbit sander that is easy to use and adjust the setting for various uses. We've used this to help with paint preparation applications in several rooms and on several pieces of furniture, and it works as well now as the day we got it! Makita makes great power tools.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Typical Makita
customer_reviews.text: Typical awesome Makita quality. I have beaten this sander up for the past couple years, and damned near every day. It’s a great sander, variable speed is key for me. But it’s really hard to beat Makita quality and reliability. Main thing is, the oscillation isn’t so radiacal so it won’t make “pigtails” as easily as some other brands I’ve had. Get yourself one and thank me later
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase. Using Mestool sanding disks and can't believe how quickly this sander works without leaving any visible marks even at 100 grit. Dust collection bag works well, but I hooked up a $10 washing machine drain hose over a #10 o-ring to my shop vac for near dustless sanding. Very comfortable to use for extended time one or two handed and easy to control due to design of main handle + adjustable secondary handle. Glad I did my research, but wish I would have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Yan Yang Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This sander is a workhorse. Have owned it since 2016 and use it consistently. Replaced the pad a year ago (off brand) which is not quite comparable to the Makita brand, but was less expensive. It's never given me a problem. I consistently use compressed air to keep dust out of the motor so maybe that has helped. It has been and continues to be a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hearn

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of random orbit Sanders!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this thing 10 stars I would. I am a firm believer that you tools should be as reliable as you are. I have been buying dewalt tools for years now and I have come to the dark side. Makita is now my favorite brand of tools. This thing is smooth, efficient and does not lack in the power department. It worked circles around my dewalt sander literally.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Sander was a little bigger than I expected, but it made it easier to control and the way seem to do a better job of sending with less effort for me. 1st time out of the box. It was easy to handle and help make job a lot easier. My previous sander was a DeWalt, which he finds out that it was a lot smaller and required a lot more work in my. I'm very pleased with the performance of the Makita and recommend it to anyone there wants a high-performance center in a pretty reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Feiger

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, and orders of magnitude better than my crappy B&D fire storm. Works several times faster. 2 knocks that are minor. Speed control dial has no detents. So it tends to move due to vibration and your hand hitting it. Not really a problem. Doesn't come with a dust collection hose or adapter so you have to improvise. The dust collection bag works well though. I love this sander and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel Poulos

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this sander. Its my favorite tool. Glad I reaeached and found this one, was going to go with a DeWalt but found the usability of this one better..
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Davis

customer_reviews.title: WOW this thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love all the different ways you can hold this thing to ensure comfort. It also has AMAZING dust collection when you connect it to the Makita branded 10' hose they sell for an extra $25, which you then connect to shop vac. I have no bad things to say about this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Terepocki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent palm sander,
customer_reviews.text: Excellent palm sander and I have found the swivel handle to be very useful when I need to sand the edges. I should’ve spent the extra $10 and got the case though. Just so others know Amazon does have this same sander with a case for $10 more.
customer_reviews.author: G B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sander
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for several months, I'd buy another one. Several of my friends have commented they like it better than their Dewalt sanders and it's performed well on a variety of projects. Here's the breakdown: Pros: - Excellent dust collection - Locking on/off & variable speed - Extra handle for added control and leverage (I love this feature!) - Great power Cons: - Wobbles a lot at lows speeds (below 3), not a big deals since I rarely sand this slow but it's functionally useless at these speeds. - Dust bag occasionally falls off, it's just a pressure fit which usually works but makes a mess the 1% of the time it gets bumped off.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal

customer_reviews.title: This sander made my husband a believer!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has always been very reluctant to use a sander, preferring to go old school and use sanding paper even on larger projects. We had a major project coming up and I insisted on buying this sander. Now that he's used it, his sanding paper is a relic of the past!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sander
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I had a Bosch orbital sander that I thought was good but this thing is so much better in terms of power and ergonomics. I used to hate sanding projects. I still don't like sanding but this had made is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best, trash the rest.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Makita and is the best sander I've ever owned. And there's been about 10 different one (not all Makita). Worth every penny. Powerful. And adapts to your vacuum to reduce dust. It has very strong hooks that hold the sanding pad very well.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent orbital
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old Makita orbital sander that we no longer had. Loved the old one and love this one! Makita makes some great, long lasting, products!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron T

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sander. I used this to refinish some doors. It does a fantastic job with heavy grit for fast material removal. It also handles finer grits just as well, providing a very smooth and swirl free finish in hardwood. Very little vibration and plenty of power. Much better than the short lived Milwaukee I had (the pad brake failed all the time). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wolf

customer_reviews.title: just buy a cheap one because that is what this
customer_reviews.text: the sander lasted about 20 minutes before the pad started to rotate so slow i could grab it with my hand and stop it waiting on the replacement bought this because of the good reviews half of them are probably fake
customer_reviews.author: kerry thorson

customer_reviews.title: It's Rico Suave Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Porter Cable sander that I started out with. I've completed several projects since and this sander has made a tedious task far quicker. Big fan of the adjustable handle on the front. Really allows you to get good control and leverage on the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product with a dust bag that works, and that will seemingly last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I ended up putting together an absolutely awesome desk out of 2x4s and 2x8s, and thanks to this guy, everything went smooth as butter. I'm glad I decided to pony up a little bit more cash for this versus some of the other cheaper models. This has a lot of (adjustable) power, and the dust bag surprisingly does a really good job collecting the dust. I can see this thing lasting forever. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sander for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are going to spend the big bucks on a Mirca or Festool orbital sander, this one is an excellent choice. Not sure why you would need variable speeds but the adjustable handle and dust collection work great! good holding position and does not leave swirly patterns in surfaces like some of the cheaper models I have used. Overall a great choice and I will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Brundin

customer_reviews.title: Durable, powerful sander
customer_reviews.text: I used this mainly to sand the trim package for my house (clear vertical grain fir with a clear finish). It has lots of power and control. Speed control is accurate and consistent. The dust collector works well and it has an extra long cord. The front stabilizer is handy when sanding larger pieces. Came with a great, durable case with plenty of room for the cord, the tool and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: OlyNomad

customer_reviews.title: Good build quaility
customer_reviews.text: I used it continuously for hours outside in the AZ heat a few weeks ago to sand down a table top. Low vibration at max speed. Worked well and seems to be of good quality. I am glad I got the version with the case. I found the handle very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay Patel

customer_reviews.title: Well put together tool. A joy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Oh, so this is how a random orbital is supposed to work. This sander is terrific. The variable speed is the best part, being able to tailor the speed to the work. Fantastic fit and finish, a true pleasure to use. It feels like it should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Holmes

customer_reviews.title: It's a Makita... you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Been using the heck out of this little sander since I got it. It's solid, reliable and with all the ways to grip it, it's extremely flexible. I absolutely would never buy another sander that wasn't variable-speed: absolutely ramps up it's usability. No 'downside' from me.
customer_reviews.author: KC Jones

customer_reviews.title: Yet another Makita tool that I love
customer_reviews.text: This sander is well balanced has a built in dust feature, a variable speed control, and optional second handle for doing large sanding jobs. If you are rebating getting the case or not do it. It's so easy to take the sander around when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy 7

customer_reviews.title: Really like the variable speed and handle features...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a single speed Porter Cable random orbit sander for years and this Makita random orbit sander is more comfortable and easier to use with the variable speed control and handle.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Impressive tool
customer_reviews.text: I have been very impressed with Makita tools lately. Nice, moderately priced tool. Reliable. Gives good control. Only complaint, Makita needs to make it easier to use/find hose connections. I had to rig one using a dishwasher hose connector and a c-clamp ring.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality- but now
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ. Appreciated the extra handle. Size is great especially for big jobs. Thought I would go cordless but I have a dust collector hooked up when using anyway. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: InTheHeartofTexas

customer_reviews.title: Good sander with variable speed and decent dust collection.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for all the resurfacing / rust removing applications I have applied it to. If you can manage to attach a dust collection / shop vac to this thing it actually works pretty well to reduce dust mess. I highly recommend using a dust mask while doing any sanding as any small particulates even just wood can be hazardous to your lungs.
customer_reviews.author: Philonious

customer_reviews.title: Great Sander For The Money
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best RO sander for the money. Dust collection is adequate, even without a vacuum, and there's plenty of power for most DIY jobs. The trigger switch is so convenient, and the removeable handle makes it much easier to control than a palm sander.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SANDER FOR DIY
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, powerful, gets into confined areas surprisingly well. The dust collection port was a bit of a struggle to connect to the hose. There are clear instructions online with tips to make it go easier. I would definitely buy this again. Terrific value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great sander!
customer_reviews.text: The sander works very well. Be sure to get the vacuum hose and any adapter needed to connect to your shop vac. It makes a big difference having the vac sucking all the dust off the work.
customer_reviews.author: gemfinder

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat this sander!

product_meta.title: Makita BO5041K 5-Inch Random Orbit Sander Kit
product_meta.description:
Style:Tool w/ CaseAMAZON.COM
Makita's 5-Inch Random Orbit Sander with variable speed, Model BO5041K, combines power, speed and performance with better grip and control, including an innovative adjustable front handle. The BO5041K is ideal for woodworkers, finish carpenters and general contractors who require a best-in-class random orbit sander.



The BO5041K features a Makita-built 3 AMP motor with oversized sealed ball bearing construction for longer tool life. The variable speed control dial (4,000 - 12,000 OPM) allows the user to match the sanding speed to the material, with a large two-finger trigger switch with conveniently located lock-on button for continuous use and increased operator comfort. The large 1/8-inch random orbit action delivers fast and smooth sanding and a swirl-free finish, with a pad control system for controlled pad speed upon start-up.Additional comfort and ease-of-use features include a new adjustable front handle to allow for sanding in corners and confined areas, as well as ergonomic rubberized handles for improved operator comfort and control. The BO5041K uses quick-change five-inch eight-hole hook-and-loop abrasive disc, and has an efficient through-the-pad dust collection system that helps provide a cleaner work environment. The high-capacity dust collection system with built-in vacuum port adapter is engineered for improved dust collection. The rubberized palm grip and top handle fit like a glove with even pressure and easy control.

The Makita BO5041K includes abrasive disc, dust bag and tool case. It is engineered for cabinetry, furniture, wood boat construction, deck installation, and general carpentry. The BO5041K is just another example of Makita's commitment to innovative technology and best-in-class engineering.

About Makita's Power Tools
Makita delivers precision, accuracy, capacity, and innovation to woodworkers. Makita has full range of miter saws, jig saws, circular saws, routers, planers, sanders, nailers and staplers, blades, compact cordless drills and impacts, and more. Makita's woodworking solutions are engineered for pro contractors, for use in high production settings and in home shops.

About Makita
Makita is a worldwide manufacturer of industrial quality power tools and offers a wide range of industrial accessories. Makita applies leading-edge innovation to engineer power tools that are more compact and energy efficient, yet deliver industrial strength power and results. Makita U.S.A., Inc. is located in La Mirada, California, and operates an extensive distribution network located throughout the U.S. For more information, please call 800/4-MAKITA (800/462-5482) or visit makitatools.com. Makita is Best in Class Engineering.

Warranty
Every Makita tool is thoroughly inspected and tested before leaving the factory. If you are not satisfied with any Makita tool within 30 days of purchase, return it and Makita will provide a replacement or refund. Each Makita tool is warranted to be free of defects from workmanship and materials for the period of ONE YEAR from the date of original purchase. Should any trouble develop during this one-year period, return the COMPLETE tool, freight prepaid, to one of Makita's Factory or Authorized Service Centers. Please see makitatools.com for complete details.

Whats in the Box
Makita BO5041K 5-Inch Random Orbit Sander, abrasive disc, dust bag and tool case.






FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Makita's new 5 inch random orbit sander has a variable speed control dial (4,000 -12,000 OPM) to match the sanding speed to the material. It has a pad control system for controlled pad speed upon start up along with an efficient through-the -pad dust collection system for cleaner working enviroment. The pad brake is engineered for increased performance and reduced gouging. Uses 5 inch (8-hole) hook and loop abrasive paper. It has a high capacity dust collection system with built in vacuum port adapter for improved dust collection. Oversized sealed ball bearing construction for longer tool life and it is double insulated.
